drawing_instructions.thinking: When feeling angry, I want to express this through sharp, jagged lines that slash across the canvas aggressively. I'll start with a bold diagonal line in intense red, cutting from the upper left to lower right - like a burst of anger tearing through the blank space. This will be the first of several angry slashes that will create a chaotic, emotional composition.

I see a bold red diagonal slash already on the canvas, which embodies rage. To intensify this angry emotion, I'll add another fierce diagonal line crossing over the first one in the opposite direction, creating an 'X' shape - a universal symbol of negation and conflict. I'll use a darker shade of red to represent intensifying anger, making this stroke even more aggressive and forceful than the first.

The canvas now shows a bold red X - a powerful symbol of anger and negation. To amplify this rage, I'll add aggressive zigzag lines erupting from the center of the X, like anger radiating outward. Using the wiggle brush with a fierce red color will create jagged, unstable lines that express the volatile nature of anger. I'll place these around the intersection point (400, 250) and have them burst outward in all directions.

Looking at the canvas, I see a powerful X with radiating zigzag lines expressing rage. To intensify this angry emotion further, I'll add aggressive, sharp spiky lines in the darkest red around the edges - like thorns or shards of glass - to symbolize how anger can feel sharp and painful. I'll use the wiggle brush to create these jagged, pointed shapes that burst outward from each end of the X, making the whole composition feel more volatile and explosive.

The canvas shows an intense X with radiating angry lines, but I want to amplify the feeling of rage even more. I'll add a series of aggressive, jagged zigzags in the darkest red (#4B0000) to create a chaotic, almost shattered pattern in the middle area of the X intersection. This will symbolize the explosive, uncontrollable nature of intense anger, like something breaking apart from within. The pattern will form a rough square shape around the center point, suggesting contained but volatile energy.

Looking at the intense X with its radiating spikes and zigzags, I want to add more chaotic, explosive energy at the center. I'll use the wiggle brush with a brighter red to create a series of short, sharp, erratic lines that burst outward from the intersection point, like an anger explosion. These quick, aggressive strokes will enhance the feeling of uncontrolled rage and emotional turbulence.

Looking at the intense angry X pattern, I'll intensify the feeling of explosive rage by adding more dark red jagged spikes that radiate from the center outward, like shards of glass or lightning bolts. Using the darkest red will create a sense of dangerous, seething anger. I'll position these sharp, angular strokes to pierce through the existing pattern, making the whole composition feel more violent and unstable.

Looking at the explosive X with its radiating angry patterns, I want to add more intense, chaotic elements. I'll use the wiggle brush with the darkest red (#4B0000) to create aggressive, sharp zigzag patterns near the corners, like anger bursting beyond containment. These new strokes will be wild and unpredictable, reflecting uncontrolled rage that can't be contained within the X's boundaries.

Looking at the chaotic, angry X with its explosive patterns, I feel the need to add more violent energy. I'll use the marker brush with the most intense red (#FF2F2F) to create thick, aggressive slashes that cut across the center, overlaying the existing X. These bold strokes will symbolize the raw, unfiltered rage that feels like it's slicing through everything. The marker's solid, heavy lines will contrast with the wiggly patterns, adding another layer of aggressive energy.

Looking at the intense, rage-filled X with its explosive patterns and sharp angles, I want to add more aggressive energy. I'll use the marker brush with an even darker, blood-red color (#4B0000) to create forceful slashes radiating from the center - like anger violently bursting outward. These thick, bold strokes will be placed strategically around the central intersection point, creating a star-burst effect that emphasizes the explosive nature of the emotion.

The canvas is filled with an intense, violent X pattern with radiating lines and dark slashes. To amplify this furious energy even more, I'll add explosive, jagged zigzags using the wiggle brush in bright Light Red to create a sense of shattering, unstable anger around the edges. These wild, erratic strokes will suggest uncontained rage bursting beyond the boundaries, like emotional shrapnel flying outward.

The canvas is filled with an intense X pattern and chaotic zigzags, but my anger demands more destruction. I'll use the spray brush to create a violent burst of black dots concentrated heavily around the center intersection point, like an explosion of fury radiating outward. This will add a sense of violent disintegration to the already aggressive composition, making it feel like the whole image is shattering apart from pure rage.

The canvas is pulsing with violent energy, but my anger demands even more intensity. I'll add aggressive, jagged zigzags using the wiggle brush in deep dark red (#4B0000) to create chaotic, sharp-edged patterns emerging from each corner of the canvas - like pure rage radiating inward towards the explosive center. These wild, angular strokes will enhance the feeling of uncontrolled fury and destructive energy.

The canvas is erupting with violent energy, but I want to make it even more intense. I'll add thick, bold marker strokes in a blazing Light Red at key intersections of the X, creating hot spots of concentrated rage. These will be like pressure points where the fury is most concentrated, making the whole composition feel like it's about to explode with anger. I'll place these aggressive circular motions at four points where the main diagonals meet the edges.

Looking at the explosive, rage-filled canvas with its stark X and chaotic elements, I want to amplify the feeling of anger by adding violent, jagged lightning-like strokes bursting from the center. I'll use the wiggle brush with the darkest red to create sharp, aggressive lines that radiate outward like shards of fury exploding from the central point. This will make the composition feel even more unstable and charged with destructive energy.
